resources.string: "Please enter a minimum temperature between 0°C and 60°C"
"Please enter a minimum temperature between 32°F and 140°F"
"Please enter a maximum temperature between 0°C and 60°C"
"Please enter a maximum temperature between 32°F and 140°F"

Need help? 
To select the aquarium desired, a dropdown menu is included in the header. 
In the Home page, the overall status of the aquarium is displayed as “Healthy” or “Warning”. If your aquarium is in a healthy state, the status is displayed in green. If it is in danger, it is displayed in yellow. 
Current values of temperature, pH and salinity are displayed as buttons right below the overall status. Each of the 3 buttons leads to a more detailed page. 
Healthy ranges: 
Temperature: 35°C to 45°C or 308.15K to 318.15 
pH: 2 to 5

Need help? 
The color of the pH button’s text is set to green or yellow depending on whether or not the value is in range (2 to 5) 
The pH data of current and past values are summarized and laid out on the page. 
There is a listView option which displays a log of the pH values.

Need help? The current temperature value of your aquarium is displayed at the top. In the temperature page, a graph displays all temperature values based on what timestamp is selected below the graph. The measurement unit can be selected in your Settings page as Celsius (°C) or Kelvin (K). There is a listView option which displays a log of the temperature values.

Need help? The aquarium name desired can be entered in the “Aquarium name” textbox. Push notifications can be enabled if desired. Temperature units can be displayed as Celsius (°C) or Kelvin (K). Safe ranges of the aquarium for temperature, pH and salinity are displayed.
Choose an aquarium to view it\'s parameters, or create a new aquariums.
